item.title: My full #govoxbox review
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I got the chance to participate in a VoxBox by Influenster, and this time it was all about being active. In my #GoVoxBox, I was given Playtex tampons, which I have done a big review on, Next Step shaker & 3 sample shakes, Blueberry Flavored Almonds, ProFoot Triad Orthodic inserts and ProFoot Pedi-Rock, Aqua Spa Bath Salts, and a voucher for a FREE Muller Yogurt.

*I was compensated for this post with free products through Influenster. The opinions stated are my own, as no one is the boss of me!*
So, I was super stoked to be given the opportunity to try out these products.I even did a YouTube video of the unboxing.




Playtex Sport Tampons


I REALLY liked this product. It made my period less intrusive on my life. I was able to feel normal while taking Midol. From a person who usually feels too gross to work out, this is pretty gosh darn awesome. You can read more on my thoughts with Playtex at my review.

Vitamin Shoppe Next Step Fit N Full


Even though I am now a Beachbody Consultant and sell Shakeology, I was not when I tried Next Step. I really enjoyed this product. It tastes great and mixes very well. It is a great option for people who are not ready to jump into Shakeology. Here is my review on YouTube.



Blue Diamond Blueberry Flavored Almonds


Honestly, this quickly became my all time favorite item in this box. I LOVE candied almonds but the flavoring of these were really awesome. The package was perfect for a protein snack in the middle of the day when I am feeling run down. I didn't take a picture of these because I had eaten them too fast. *oops*

ProFoot Products

Another product that I talked about on my blog post about working out as a female was ProFoot. I was not thrilled with the Orthotic insert but I LOVE the Pedi-Rock. The Pedi-Rock massages my foot while making it soft & smooth. It is definitely a product I will be keeping.

The last two products I cannot post a review on yet because I have not yet tried them. I have not had the energy to take a long soak without having to worry about the children. I am going to be trying the yogurt this weekend though!

If you have any questions about the products on this post, please put them in the comments and I will answer them the best I can!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Would you recommend shakeology over next step and why

item.title: My oldest child is a middle schooler!
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I cannot get over the fact I now have a middle schooler in this house. How in the world did this happen? I swear it was only yesterday that she was born! I love my little Peanut and couldn't be prouder of her. However, age can slow down at any point! We celebrated her achievement today and thanks to Chinet, we were able to do it in style.

*Note - we were given a package with plates, napkins, cups, and other goodies from Chinet through House Party. We were not required to blog about it, and all opinions are my own.*

Late in the evening of February 28, 2003. We all waited impatiently for Adella (Peanut) to make her presence into the world. Grandma Mo and daddy were present, and mommy was so tired. After HOURS of waiting and very little time for actual delivery, we were greeted with our first child at 10:01pm.



While Adella is my only child that went to preschool, the pictures really started when she started school. In 2008, she was enrolled in Crestview Elementary in Overland Park, KS. Between 2008 and 2014, she attended Crestview, The Birdcage (home school), Indian Valley Elementary, and New Chelsea Elementary School. I cannot believe she has grown up so fast. I made a video slide show and be warned ... you MAY just tear up.



Today, we got to have a graduation celebration with family and friends. Through HouseParty, I threw a Chinet party with their new plates, "It's Hip to Be Square." We LOVED them. Their cups are awesome because they look super classy, without looking cheap. Here are a few of the photos from the party. We had a taco bar, chips & dip, cookies, cake, and punch. Adella really enjoyed herself and I was happy to give her the party she desperately wanted!


Most of the group ... there are 5 people not in this photo that were there. :)

item.title: Celebrated our anniversary early
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Before I get into today's post, I must first state a correction in the last post I made. I stated in that post that I love Shakeology but couldn't afford it at the moment. I then stated that I would purchase Fit n' Full by Next Step ... and THAT is where the correction has come in.

I have joined Team Beachbody and now get Shakeology at a discount. I have made it a priority to care for my health. I have firmly believed in Shakeology for a year now, so this is not a new love. I will have posts on this blog about my weight loss journey, as I want others to see that it is possible that with hard work and dedication, it is possible to lose weight without surgery. This will be coming from a person who has battled weight issues for 20 years.

NOW ... onto the real point of this post! My anniversary!!





Jeremy and I started dating in August of 2000. We had known each other since high school and we both had crushes on each other but neither of us knew it. When he started dating one of my dear friends, I backed off. However ... when I heard they no longer were together, I reached out and started communicating again.

In December of 2001, Jeremy was preparing to leave for Kansas City to work with his dad at Treat America. I drug his butt to Wal-Mart and showed him the engagement ring I had been eyeballing. We then got married on May 25, 2002.


We had our honeymoon at the Riverwalk and really enjoyed it. We didn't do anything big for our anniversaries due to having two little ones, but for our 5th anniversary, we got a sitter to watch Peanut & Bullfrog. We went to Chateau Avalon and spent a lot of time at the Legends.


For our 10 year anniversary in 2012, we went to Fort Scott WITH the kids and stayed at the Lyons Cottage. We had our 2 dogs and 3 kids with us so ... yeah, it was a great trip but NOT as romantic as we had hoped. Not to mention ... I was sick as a dog being pregnant with Willow.


This year, we saw an opportunity and we took it. There is a new theater in Overland Park and they had their social media weekend last weekend, and this weekend was their Groupon Preview weekend. The Groupon rates were $9.95 per person for four movies (although they stated otherwise on their page originally. It didn't matter though because we only had time for four). We went for it when we secured a sitter.


We watched Serenity, Star Trek (2009), Star Trek: Into the Darkness, and Raiders of the Lost Ark. Here is my review of Cinetopia, because we had a movie in every type of theater they have.

GXL - This theater (for us) was no different than most of the other theaters we have gone to. I do not believe it is worth the $13.50/ticket, personally. Not when I can go to another theater for only $10.50 with the same quality of seats and sound. Sorry, Cinetopia. We watched both Star Trek movies in this theater.

Living Room - This was our FAVORITE room. The seats recline with a power button and they are grouped by two. There is an age limit of 21, so those who want to take alcohol in, can. The sound is amazing and the seats are UBER comfortable. I TOTALLY feel this is worth the ticket price. We watched Serenity in this theater.

Parlor Room - I was so excited about this room with the cuddle couches. There are only a few couches though and they are all the way in the front. TOTAL disappointment. The rest of the seats are ... meh. Also, the lights do not go completely down so where we sat, we had lights on dim the ENTIRE time. So frustrating. We actually talked about leaving a few times. This is another theater that is 21 or older only. We watched Raiders in this theater.

Overall, we were disappointed with their popcorn but the prices of everything else (snack bar) was on par with other theaters we have gone to. They are opening Memorial Day weekend with X-Men.

The area was really nice and reminded us a lot of Aggieville and the Plaza smushed together. It was really nice. We had a great time on our kid-free date ... and apparently, our children had a blast too!


*Note - I went to the movies on my own finances. I was not compensated for this review, nor was I asked to give one. Everything stated here is my own opinion.*

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The one thing I LOVE about the Kansas City Metro is the beautiful fountains you can find all over. I just wish the transportation system on the Kansas side was better. :)
Congratulations EARLY! Looks like you had an amazing time. I love your wedding dress. These places look super fun. I love the fountains. Thanks for sharing! The theater sounds incredible.

item.title: It's been rough
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
You ever have those days where you don't want to talk to people because you have absolutely nothing nice to say? Yup, it has been one of those weeks. I have had one of those weeks where almost everything either annoys me or I am just not "not feeling it."

However, with it being Mother's Day, I am pulling out of my funk long enough to write a post.



In May of 2002, I became a wife and learned I would be a mother only 7 weeks later. A pregnancy during the first year of marriage is one way to see how strong your marriage will be. We learned very early that we could lean on each other to push through the tough times. I became a mother on February 28, 2003. Peanut took FOREVER to enter the world and there were talks of possible c-sections. She came out on her own schedule at 10:01pm and has been the face of a million expressions ever since.

We discovered in November of 2002 that we were expecting again. We were scared and unsure what to do. We lost the child only three weeks later, but we realized that we were definitely called to have more than one child. We decided to start trying in early 2003 for another child.


My labor with Bullfrog was extremely difficult and I couldn't bring myself to even think about pregnancy or deliver for several years. When he was four, we started trying to have a child again. We were where we wanted to be financially and really enjoying life. We were blessed a pregnancy finally in the beginning of 2010. Jeremy and I could not have been happier. However, our happiness was dashed when I suffered a miscarriage in March of 2010, at 12 weeks. We found out the child had died around 9 weeks of age. We had to go through the pain of a natural miscarriage since our insurance would not cover a medicinal one. It didn't break our hopes. We restarted trying and became pregnant in late June 2010.


Monkey joined our family on April 7, 2011. Her childhood was plagued with difficulty with weight gain. We decided that our family was complete and began to settle down. However, God had other plans for us. I got real sick in late March 2012 and we were pretty sure I was pregnant. It took a LONG time for the pregnancy tests to tell us what we already knew. An unplanned pregnancy, and one that threw my entire life for a loop (dealing with PPD, financial strain, and pregnancy), I was worried how our family would cope. I remained faithful, even with the trials we went through after August of 2012, and in December (a week after my due date), I would deliver my final child.


Every Mother's Day has brought a time to reflect on my life and how much I have grown. I have been a parent for just over 11 years, but I have learned a lot. I am now preparing to enter the life of a mom of a teenager and I am not sure I am ready for it. However, just as I was not sure I was ready to be a parent, I have faith that the Lord will guide me through.

I have some of the BEST friends to help me along the way, and a husband who is my rock. With faith, hope, and love ... I will continue to parent my children to the best of my ability.

Happy Mother's Day to all those who are parents of children, parents of fur babies, parents who have lost a child, and women who long to have a child of their own. You are all loved and thought of this day.

item.title: Yes, I'm a Mom ... But I'm Me Too!
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I know I owe another A to Z Challenge post, but I feel the need to post this today. There is a video that has gone viral and while it is a great way to acknowledge moms, I disagree with much of it.



So, this is the video. Many people have seen it ... in fact, it has had over 10 million hits. Where is my problem? Let me get into that.


My job description as a mother:
~ Care for my unborn child for 9 months (or 10+ in my case) making sure I care for my body so they are born as healthy as possible.
~ Tend to my child night and day as he/she experiences teething, hunger, bad dreams, anxiety, and growing pains.
~ Teach my child
~ Provide for my child
Source
However ... what I also know is that this job for me (and millions of other moms) is it is a team effort. Moms are not alone in the job! My husband takes turns staying up with the children, helping out when they are ill, taking them to events, teaching them, playing with them, etc. He does this so that I do not have to tackle the task by myself and I can sit, sleep, eat, etc.

Here are my BIGGEST beefs with this video.
  1. I did NOT go into this job expecting to be praised, paid, or receive benefit (outside of love).
  2. I did NOT go into this position so that I could brag about being a parent.
  3. I did NOT go into this position to be a slave of the "associate"
My children love and respect me (most of the time). They understand fully that my needs are just as important as theirs are. Even at the age of 3, Monkey knows that mommy needs time to get out with friends, sleep, eat, and shower. Turtle is getting there as well, but I do not expect as much since she is only 16 months.

My children know that they have duties to help around the house. My husband was awesome in explaining to Peanut the difference between chores and responsibilities last night. A chore helps the entire family, while a responsibility benefits you.

I do not receive monetary compensation for this job ... but the amount of love I get from my children is more than enough payment for me! My life revolves around God, my family, and me ... in that order.

Yes, it is a tough job, and it may be the world's toughest job to be the parent, but I don't want my children to respect me for the reasons stated in the video. I want them to love me and respect me because of the love and respect that I show them. I want them to love me because I have their back through thick and thin, no matter what mistakes they make. I am there to help them pick up the pieces and recover. To me, THAT is what being a parent is about.

So, bring on the heat .... I have given my two cents. I am fully aware that not everyone agrees.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Exactly! I LOVE my children, but I also believe that they should learn that you treat others with the same respect they want in return. :)

I believe we raise our children with our core values and do the best we can. Being involved with every aspect during their growing years, is the key. I love to give to my child and others based on that was given to me.

When you look at our own children and see the results of our love and support. It makes the pains and fears well worth it.

Thank you for sharing you inner most passion with us reader. I love the interaction of you site.

item.title: Busy Day!
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Today has been one of the best in a long time. I told Monkey last night that we were going to go purchase a book or two with her money from Aunt Shannah. She was SO excited. What I didn't tell her was that Dora was going to be at the mall as well! I had been looking forward to today all week long!

On the way to Barnes & Noble, we talked about how many books we were going to get. Chloe told me she was only going to get one book today. I was totally okay with that, although I knew the selecting process would take longer. It was okay though because we had two hours to just have fun.



Taking in all the books

Starting the selection process

She had a HARD time deciding between these two
After we settled on a book (the musical one), she was ready to go play. We still had an hour before Dora was coming so I took her to the play area of Oak Park Mall. Monkey was cracking me up with her sitting on the car and waving to me like a princess. She had lots of kids wanting to talk to her and that was causing her to shut down a bit though.


After playing for quite awhile, we went to wait on Dora. She was SO excited that she talked about it non-stop. Well, that was until Dora came out. It was great while Dora was in the distance ... as she neared, and her size grew .... Monkey was a little more than intimidated. She did let me get her picture taken with Dora ... as long as I held her!



After coming home, we got everybody ready to go and then headed to the church. It was the day Bullfrog was being baptized. He wanted it done when he was 8, but he wasn't home on his birthday. We waited until he was home and we got back into a routine. Then he had to go through the missionary discussions since he was over 8 years old. It was nice having them over weekly. One of the missionaries got transferred to the Independence stake, but he came back for the baptism (which was awesome).
Many of the family members were able to make it! <3

Bullfrog was bummed because he was told to be serious

Missionaries on the left are our current ones, and the one on the right came back
The day was just overwhelming for our Monkey ... she collapsed in the car on the drive home ... and then again on daddy's lap after dinner & ice cream.




So ... how did you spend your Saturday?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: What a wonderful day Heather! I have a niece that just loves Dora. She would have been ecstatic to find out she got to meet her. Thanks for sharing all of your wonderful pictures!

I agree ... there is no reason they couldn't use a smaller version. When my oldest daughter was three or four, we went and saw Dora and the Pirate Piggies live. They didn't use a scary Dora, they used a girl who dressed up like Dora. It was perfect.

Hi Heather I'm a bit disappointed that Dora is so tall, she looks a bit strange like that! My grand- daughter loves Dora too, and I don't think she'd like to see her that big. I saw today that Dora is coming to where I live next week, she must be doing a tour of Australia!

item.title: Thrively & Children
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I was reading on another blog (Mommy Chronicles) about Thrively and realized that I wanted to know more about my children. This site is just awesome. There is about a 45 minute survey that your children answer and then they select things that interest them.

I must say I was surprised by a LOT of the answers that Bullfrog gave, Peanut ... not so much. They took their time and were very honest with the answers. Here are their results. For those who know my children ... do you agree?

Bullfrog -

you are analytical with impressive athleticism

You have a great and unique gift of being able to focus on details and to create solutions in a step by step manner. You know how to consider and analyze an array of complex vairables and are a strong problem-solver. You rely on your ability to quickly understand systems and bring your existing knowledge to bear to make decisions and break the pieces of a puzzle apart one by one, carefully analyzing each. You are a rational and intense thinker with true vulcan mind power.

You have a passion for playing sports and have a strong competitive spirit. You strive to further develop your strength, speed, and coordination ... assets that serve you well in competition. You take winning seriously as well as practicing and getting better. You may often find yourself thinking about what it takes to get to the next level in sports... keep working, you never know how far you can go until you push yourself!

YOUR STRENGTHS

  • Analytical
  • Athleticism
  • Academic
  • Creative Thinking
  • Verbal 

Peanut -

you are a great communicator with a dose of academic excellence and a distinct worldliness

You care about your grades and academic performance, are studious, and have a strong memory. You are a conscientious, college-bound student who won't be intimidated by a test.

You have an extraordinary gift of gab and can usually talk your way out of any situation. You perform well in language arts activities and express yourself well. You would make an exceptional debator as you know intuitively how to create and defend an argument and position. When you are older, you will blow college admissions personnel and employers away during interviews. Your words flow, and you can appreciate finer language nuances. You get hidden meanings and abstract ideas and can explain them clearly. You are persuasive indeed!

You like to look outside your day to day and consider big thoughts and ideas. You realize that the world is a very large place of which you want to be a part. You enjoy people, places, travel, culture, history, and learning through experience.

YOUR STRENGTHS

  • Morality
  • Verbal
  • Academic
  • Compassion
  • Worldly


The best part about Thrively is the fact they offer activities online and local that you can put your children into. They list them based on the interests the child selected and the analysis of their strengths. You can find camps all over the country, but you can also type in your city to get local ones. There are things here in Kansas City that I had no idea about. I just love this site!

I am in the trial Free Beta period, but I do plan to continue whenever the period ends. :)

item.title: The minimum wage struggle is REAL
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I know it is not a widely popular stance. Everyone finds it easier to lash out at the ones who are looking to jump the minimum wage from $7/hr to $15/hr. I have my reservations on the jump occurring overnight, but I totally understand the struggle. While I know it will be tempting to immediately jump to commenting and lashing out, please attempt to read my position first.


 I am going to try to keep my thoughts on this organized, as there are many facets to the problem. The first problem is that minimum wage does not discriminate between teenagers who are looking to bring in a little income to cover expenses and give them freedom, and the adults who are trying to take care of their family. For the sake of arguments, I am going to IGNORE the teens who do not need to make a living wage. For teens who are simply going to school and wanting some extra money, I think that the $7/hr is sufficient. In fact, I really don't even hear them the ones vocalizing anyway. So, from this point forward ... I am simply talking about the individuals who are needing to support their family.


My Stance

My stance on the fight is that minimum wage should EQUAL living wage. Regardless of where you live. The most vocal of the fights that I am seeing online take place in New York. New York has a much higher cost of living than where I live in Kansas. I think the living wage should be higher. When you pay people a living wage, you will immediately reduce the number of people who have to turn to the government for cash assistance, food stamps, and so forth. This is another fight that I hear many people complain about. I also believe that people who work in a skilled position (requiring higher degrees) should be paid more than $15/hr. When you are looking at skilled jobs, you need to not only be able to live, but you need to make enough to pay off the debt you accrued by getting the skills necessary. I am personally SICK of corporate greed and companies who do not value their employees. Most of the companies that are fighting this are making BILLIONS at the expense of their employees.

Argument #1 - People Need to "Better" Themselves

I hate this statement. Really, truly, HATE it. This stance puts you in a position where you are talking down to others. You have absolutely NO idea what they have been through or why they are doing the work they are. Secondly, you are going under the assumption that they do not like their job to start with. I personally believe in the stance of "someone's got to do it." People want to eat out ... someone's got to flip the burgers and act as supervisor.  People need janitors ... someone's got to do it. Those people aren't any less than you are!

The other assumption you are making is that they are not skilled. The economy began to fail in 2008. The corporations failed to run their businesses in a manner that could sustain them and began to go belly up ... and fast. People lost jobs ... SKILLED people lost jobs. You know what happens when you are out of the workforce for a while? You have a heck of a time getting back IN to the workforce. People don't want to hire you because you are OVER qualified and others don't want to hire you because you have been out for too long.

It is also being shown that going to college is not benefiting people the way it is expected to. People cannot find jobs when they get out of college ... even in high demand areas. My husband is extremely lucky to have gotten a job when he did!

Argument #2: Don't have kids if you can't afford them

Another ignorant statement that I severely dislike. I hear this ... a LOT. Guess what people, there are 2 HUGE complications with this statement!

  1. People may have had the children when they COULD afford them and then lost their jobs.

  2. You cannot regulate sex or removal of the uterus. These are the only 2 ways to guarantee no babies.
However ... my friend, Brandy, said it best on my Facebook wall when we were discussing welfare (directly related to low wages):
"I think something we need to remember is that we ALL receive government assistance, it just isn't criticized and critiqued like welfare because it isn't as obvious and out there. Using myself as an example, as a person who is considered middle class/ upper middle class I receive child tax credits, free speech for my daughter through the school system (a value of about $360/month), Parents As Teachers for my toddler, public schooling for my kindergartener, I take advantage of local child development checks, a playroom and item checkout, public library, shall I go on? Yet I'm certain no one is critiquing how I spend the tax credits or making sure that, since I don't pay for my daughters speech, I am not using any of that $360 a month that I'm saving toward entertainment, alcohol, etc. And heck, I am a stay at home mom! If I was working we could afford private speech therapy, yet not once has anyone suggested that I stop "abusing the system" and get a job to pay for private speech therapy rather than using the free, high quality services provided for me.

The fact is that the abuse you see is only because you are looking for it and because abuse stands out. You don't note the mom who goes through the checkout with fruit and milk and pays with SNAP, but you are going to catalog every single bag of chips purchased. The research and statistics are clear- welfare is largely used legally. If you truly believe the majority is abusive of it then you have been lied to."

Argument #3: $15/hr is so much more than I made flipping burgers

I'm sorry ... should we pay you the same amount that your parents were paid? How about your grandparents? Really, this is such a stupid argument. You paid less than $1/gallon for gasoline. You also paid less than $2 for a gallon of milk. I am not following your logic at all!

Let's break down the $15/hr so that you can see what people would be paid. Let's assume that the people who are wanting a raise increase are working full-time and trying to support their families. Let's assume they are working the only job they can due to circumstances.
$15/hr x 40/hrs/wk = $600/wk

$600/wk x 52/wks/yr = $31,200

Yup ... that's living the high life right there. $31,200 GROSS ... that isn't take home! Now, here in Kansas, I could see the wages being $13/hr because that would be roughly $27,000/yr. Is it too much to ask to be able to cover your bills and living expenses? Even if you take kids out of the equation, $15,000/yr is not going to be enough to survive.

So, sorry this is a long post ... I try to keep my posts much shorter but this is such a hard fight. I think it will be one that is going to take a process of a few years to get better. In the beginning, I couldn't understand and that was such a jump in my mind. It wasn't until I took a step back and really broke it down that it made sense. Let me know your thoughts in the comments below. Feel free to jump on my Facebook post about the minimum wage AND Brownback's welfare cuts. All I ask is to keep your language clean!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I am in total agreement with so many of your sentiments, especially the ones that pertain to those who were at least 'somewhat' well off, and in a position to afford kids, before the economy went to Hell in a hand basket. And on the fact that we all do benefit from government services in some way or another, though I would have used 'driving on roads' as the example, and I would have also pointed out that none of this was 'free' as it was all paid for by ALL of our tax dollars. For even those living in poverty do in fact pay taxes. They pay sales tax on items they buy in stores. They pay vehicle registration taxes. And lest we forget that many of the people left in financial ruin paid a lot more in to the tax system BEFORE the economic disaster of 2008, and certainly did not get any 'equitable ROI' on that investment of their tax dollars, despite the 'notion' that people should have an 'equitable tax burden.'

All that said, there is much more to be considered than merely the raising of the minimum wage.

For one thing it is not McDonald's 'fault' that the economy left so many people 'jobless.' Why should McDonald's have to bear the burden of paying the price for the mistakes that Wall Street made?

We haven't even begun to consider the effects of raising wages as they pertain to costs of goods and services going up, and number of jobs available going down...

But there is our real problem.

We are far too dependent, yes, I used the word 'dependent,' on 'jobs' to provide for us.

Why do we 'need' so many 'jobs'? Why do we pursue a life of depending on someone else to pay us enough to 'live,' regardless of our life choices, skill set and an economy we can never control...?

Why do we not 'create our own jobs?' Our own income streams?

This is where we need to start focusing.

item.title: Why kids can't have nice things ...
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
So, I hear all the time about kids being why parents can't have nice things. NORMALLY, this is a very true statement. However, in the process of less than 24 hours, I have been shown exactly why PARENTS are the reason that KIDS can't have nice things.

Let's start with the concert I attended last night. My daughter had her first orchestra concert last night. It is the same concert as last year, where the 4th & 5th graders from New Chelsea come and participate with the middle school students. I was completely blown away at the NOISE that was coming from ... wait for it ... THE ADULTS. Dead serious, folks.

I TOTALLY get the kids getting bored and having a hard time sitting through an hour long concert. I do NOT understand how the adults present felt the need to chatter through the entire concert. Guess what, there was a good break between the 4th & 5th graders, 6th graders, 7th graders, and then the 8th graders. That is FOUR breaks for tuning in a concert that was LESS than 60 minutes. Really, carry your conversation when it will not prevent the people who care about the children they came to see. If you can't, please don't come.



Moving on ... today I find out that IKEA is talking about discontinuing the Kids Eat Free  meals on Tuesdays. Why? Because PARENTS are making a big stink about getting the food without kids. Really? Let's keep it classy, peeps. This isn't the soup line. Why take advantage of a free thing? You don't even have to make a purchase to get the meals free!

When asked about the problems, the employee talked about customers (AKA PARENTS) ARGUING for over 15 minutes and making a huge scene. REALLY? That is what my FOUR year old does when things don't go her way. THEN, THEN ... parents let their children go through multiple times because they are hungry.

Now, stop. I am a HUGE proponent for No Kid Hungry ... which is why I totally get that some kids are truly hungry. However, there are MANY resources in Kansas City where you can get meals, especially over the summer! What I do NOT agree with is fighting with a business over a free kids meal.

My friend's children enjoying a free meal

They also have children who PAY for a meal while the others eat free!!
I now turn my attention to you, IKEA. I have several friends that visit your store REGULARLY ... not only for the free kids' meals, but also to go shopping. They CHOOSE that day because the meals act as a great reward for the rest of the trip. So, I completely understand your frustrations. Totally get them. Parents can ruin everything. So, here are some suggestions that you might take with you to the next employee meeting:
  1. Make a rule of no kids, no free meal. Period. No fighting, no arguing, inform them they can be escorted out if they don't like the rule.

  2. Give children a ticket upon entering IKEA ... ONE TICKET. They MUST present the ticket to get a free meal. No ticket, no meal. This eliminates the parents who think that it's okay to have "Oliver" children.
IKEA, I am so sorry that you have to deal with RIDICULOUS parents. You hear that parents? You are being utterly ridiculous. I would put my children in time out and not even allow them to go shopping with me if this is how they acted. Put yourself in a big gigantic time-out and realize you are not entitled either. What the heck is wrong with you?! Quit ruining AWESOME things our kids have. The rest of us appreciate all of the opportunities and activities that our kids have!

What are your thoughts? What should IKEA do? Should they just cancel the Kids Eat Free on Tuesdays? Should they require a purchase from adults to get it, like almost every other restaurant in town does? Comment below. Share with others to get the word out about this!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I totally agree with you! If you have no children with you--why would you think you are entitled to a free meal? Also if your child is getting the free meal, why should they be going through the line multiple times so the parent can get extra free food?

Parents sometimes set the worse examples for their kids. If you can't set an example; it is just trickling down to your children.

I agree with your ideas when it comes to the tickets, etc. That way those that do not abuse the free kids lunch do not suffer for those that have: and continue to do so.

Heather, this is well said!

I live in Massachusetts. We travel to Ikea lots of times during the year. Yet, this is something new to me?

May I ask if they have free kids meals throughout our country?

However, any child shopping with parents. Fell they deserve special attention. They go on auto-pilot to display silly jesters to get other people to notice them. They, act out.

The parent's should do old school. May I suggest feeding your kids prior to shopping. Then, allow the freebie as a desert type of hangout.

Great and funny article.

item.title: Regardless of size, remember you're beautiful
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I will restart the A to Z challenge tomorrow and just run into May. Last week has been chaotic, ending with Facebook blocking me until I get my name verified. Yup, you read that right ... I do not exist on Facebook at all. They swooped in after 9:40pm on Friday and blocked the account. Since they only verify documents during business hours ... it is now 10am on Monday and I still have no account. Oh, but I can get email updates and notifications that my "fans" are missing updates on my fan pages. I'm sure they are ... not my fault! I have absolutely no idea how long it will take for them to look at the Driver's License picture that I sent in and reinstate my account. You can currently find me on Twitter and Instagram while I wait it out.

I digress though. This post is about something that has been really weighing on me over the last few weeks.

It seems that so many people are hyperfocused on size of clothes and numbers on a scale. I cannot emphasize strongly enough how destructive this is for your body. One person's healthy may not be the same as your healthy ... and that is OKAY. Did you know that if you are not comfortable and happy with how you look, it will be extremely difficult to not only lose the weight, but maintain it?

Regardless of your size right now, you are beautiful and sexy. Beauty is on the inside and lies in the eye of the beholder. Where the confusion begins to lie is when people  believe that they don't have to lose weight because they are beautiful. Just because you are beautiful, it doesn't make you healthy!

I have spent the last several years trying to lose weight. I was not happy with how I looked, but I was struggling with losing weight. Why? I discovered over the last few months it was because I just wasn't happy with who I am. I was trying to look at weight loss the wrong way.

Since completing the Whole30, I have realized that I don't crave food and when I'm full, I don't eat any more. More importantly though, I stepped away from the scale for a great deal of time and broke that relationship. Yes, I ended up losing 16 pounds during the month of March, but more importantly, I didn't put it right back on after the month was over.

Here are a few things I want to mention before I talk about a place in Kansas City that I am still diligently working on making arrangements to go weekly.
  1. Just because someone has lost a significant amount of weight and clothing sizes by going Vegan does not mean it will work for you OR be the healthy choice for you.

  2. Just because someone goes gluten-free and loses weight or feels great does not mean that is the right lifestyle choice for you

  3. Just because you are not in the size you want to be, doesn't mean you cannot exercise

  4. Just because you can, doesn't mean you should

  5. Designate only ONE day for the scale and stay off of it the rest of the week. Your weight NATURALLY fluctuates

  6. People who have lost weight by certain methods ... STOP BULLYING PEOPLE INTO USING YOUR METHOD
Now that I am off that soapbox. Let me tell you about a place where all sizes are welcome and EVERYONE will have their butt kicked. When you go to a gym, you will have group workouts, but most people stick to the weight machines, free weights, and cardio equipment. Back in November, I talked about a completely different "gym" in Kansas City. I am REALLY hoping they eventually open up a location here in north KC so that it will be easier for me to make classes. My original goal was to make it to classes once a week, but having four kids and living 30 minutes away from the gym has yet to make this possible. Thankfully, summer is nearing and I will be able to go at LEAST once a week since my kids will be able to babysit the toddlers!

On Friday, I was given the chance to meet the designer of the Megaformer, which is the tool for pilates on crack. You focus on muscles that you wouldn't normally use, and his goal is to help teach you which muscles TRULY keep you from having aches and pains. The best part of this class is you do not have to be flexible, and the trainers are all awesome.




Friday, The Body Lab offered an Open House. Even Rob Collins from Fox4KC got in on the fun. Sebastian Lagree, founder of Lagree Fitness, came and taught the 8am class on Friday ... so you never know what's gonna happen in the class!

In the evening thought, we actually got to talk to Sebastian and a few trainers acted as models for people still investigating.



The best part of the night was actually listening to Sebastian, as he has so much passion behind his drive to help people get healthy.


Which, I think is the most important thing ... and the point of my post. You will not ever be happy with what look like, even if you are healthy, if you cannot find yourself beautiful now.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Heather, I'm so glad you wrote this post! Focusing in on clothes sizes and numbers on a scale it not the way to be physically or mentally healthy. You have to be believe that you are beautiful inside and out no matter what size you are in order to make choices that will keep you healthy. Also when you discover how to fuel your body with the right foods that make you feel great and energize you along with finding a exercise program that works for your lifestyle it will help you make sustainable changes that will last a lifetime! Thanks for sharing your great advice!

So very well said Heather!

You really made some excellent points about the subtle differences between
losing weight and being healthy!


People often automatically equate accomplishing one, means they've accomplished the other as well!

And it sounds like this gym and it's founder is going to do quite well indeed! Thanks so much for sharing this one!

What a wonderful blog post. I have struggled with my weight my whole life. It took me a long time to love and accept myself as a beautiful person but once I did it became easier for me to find success in my weight loss and health endeavors. I have always believed there is far too much emphasis on the unattainable "anorexic-look" body type we are fed daily in advertisements and not enough emphasis on what is natural and healthy in terms of different body types. Thank you for this post :).

I'm not small by any means. I speak a lot at events and give little mind to what people think unless it's constructive. I've always been this way. Though people say I look good, I really have never paid attention. I get uncomfortable when people compliment my looks, even back when I was thinner and competing in 3 sports per year, plus training at least 3 hours a day, 7 days a week.

I say to people, go on with your bad self. If someone wants to say something... just say "Well, sorry you feel that way... I happen to like myself."

What an encouraging post!! Heather, I'm so glad you've learned this at your age instead of waiting a couple more decades when increased health issues make it more difficult to dig in and turn things around. I wish I had known in my 30s what you know now. We'll never grow beyond what we believe in our hearts. It HAS to start within. I am not my size or shape any more than I am my favourite colour or the clothes I choose. What I really need is to begin to believe what my wonderful, patient husband tells me -- and regardless of the mirror, HE believes it.

item.title: Go ahead, jump. Jump!
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
My daughter has sensory processing disorder and one of her biggest things is touch. She is a seeker and loves to rough and tumble. She is not a huge fan of noise, nor does she like a lot of people around. I got the chance to review a SkyZone birthday party and I immediately chose my little Monkey.

Honestly, I was concerned about the noise and number of people when we walked in, especially when she talked about it being loud. However, I was fairly certain that once we got into the 0-4 year old area AND she started jumping, it wouldn't be so bad. I was right! Thankfully, this allowed me to take plenty of pictures, videos, and give you a really good review.

Upon Entering SkyZone

We were immediately greeted by our party hostesses at the door, which was awesome. We got our shoes off and put on the rolling shelves. We were also able to put our cake on them as well, allowing it to be taken to the party room while we had our jump time. The hostesses went over the rules and gave us our SkySocks (which normally cost but you can bring them with you each time you go). We had already filled out our waiver online (STRONGLY suggest this so you don't have to worry about it there) and it stays valid for an entire year.
Getting the Instructions
Getting help with the socks
Everyone's ready

Jumping Time

We were given stickers that had our jump time. We got 90 minutes of jumping with our party. There were 4 areas to jump, with one of them having a rotating age limit. Monkey and Turtle stayed in the 0-4 section, as there were only a couple other kids at any given time. This was perfect for Monkey, who was a little overwhelmed at first. The other area was a foam pit, where they have kids jump from trampolines into a big ... wait for it ... foam pit! Turtle was NOT about that, but the other kids loved it. One of my son's favorite locations was the basketball court. The last zone was dodge ball. This is the area that has rotating age limits. They do 5-10 year olds and then 11-14 year olds. I do believe they have an adult time ... but it is on a completely different day. I have to check into that though.

Monkey and Turtle having a blast



Bullfrog in the foam pit
Bullfrog took Monkey into the pit


Getting called out for not getting off the court when hit!
Acting like she did nothing wrong ... tricky girl
Back in the game
On the basketball court

Party Time

After the kids jumped for 90 minutes, it was time to move into the party room. We had 40 minutes for the party room, but we didn't end up using it all. SkyZone takes care of the food & beverages (soda, water, or juice) and pizza. They also provide the lighters. You simply need to bring the cake and candles! Now ... in FULL disclosure, I NEVER show my PinFAILS on my blog. I had made an adorable cupcake cake. It looked ALMOST perfect and then we went outside ..... and the wind ruined EVERYTHING. You are going to get to see the result of that pain. Yes, it absolutely frustrates me and the perfectionist in me is SCREAMING. Thankfully, Monkey did not care because it was yummy.

Finding out what Turtle needed *ignore the weirdo that kept coming into our party room!*
PinFAIL - wind and people touching my horse ... destroyed the horse *sad panda*
We got four candles to fit on a cupcake though!
And it was yummy


Our Verdict

We absolutely LOVED SkyZone KC. We have already our next visit planned. I am excited that they are doing a sensory night so Monkey can go with less noise and people.

Sky Zone is giving my readers Save $3 Off Open Jump at Sky Zone and 10% Off a Supreme Birthday Party. Click on the Sky Zone coupon below for more information and to redeem.

It really is. I figure that I can be a tad behind on the challenges because I am living in the moment with my babies!
YES!!! Not only can parents jump and participate, they also have adult dodge ball tournaments AND AirAerobics as well. It's AWESOME.

Hey Heather, Wow I wanna Play What a Great looking place, I am curious can parents participate?

Loved this, Thanks for sharing.. Chery :))

item.title: 30 Days without Sugar and What I Learned
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
So, during the month of March I decided I was going to take control of food. For the past several years, food has had control of me. I would get HORRID cravings and I just couldn't seem to break them. I would go without soda for a while but wouldn't be able to stay on that path. I had seen several friends try out Whole30 and was like ... hmmm, not sure I can do that, more power to you though!

Guess what ... I finally drank the water!


I started Whole30 on March 1st and the first few days were GREAT. I breezed through the first week. There definitely were some times when I had cravings but I didn't hit the "kill all the things" until week #2. I did a video log of week 1 and week 2.


Seriously craziness after week 3. I was able to bake cookies without the desire to eat some of the cookie dough (or the baked cookies). However, not going to lie ... day 19 to day 24, I was over the diet. I was just bored with it. Then I was doing great until day 28 when I was just ready to be done.


Since I have finished the Whole30, I have learned a few things:
  1. It is possible to lose 16 pounds in one money simply omitting sugar from your diet.

  2. It is possible to take control of your diet.

  3. It is possible to eat three times a day and NOT be hungry between meals.

  4. After finishing the diet, HFCS and I do not get along anymore ... at all

  5. After finishing the diet, eating two cookies will make me puke.

  6. I am super excited about getting to meet the Hartwigs here in KC during their book tour

  7. I discovered that I do not necessarily need a nap in the middle of the day to make it through.

  8. Water does get old after a while, but it is easy to flavor

  9. I don't have to worry about Willow or Chloe sneaking off with my drink, because it's just water!

  10. Oh, and the best part ... I do not feel a strong urge to eat crap food like I used to!
So, personally ... the Whole30 was a successful experiment. I have NO intention of doing it again for quite a while. However, I can see how beneficial it might be every January to cleanse from the holidays. I'll re-evaluate January 2016. Peanut noticed the differences and is chatting about doing the challenge herself. We shall see how that goes.

My new goal is to continue with a low-carb, low-sugar diet and prepare for the Color Run 5K at the end of May.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Heather,

Very impressive. You did it. I love 30 day challenges, having succeeded at several of them (30 blogs in 30 days, writing at least 50,000 words and completed my novel in 30 days, and more). At this point I realize that it needs to be a whole lifestyle effort, not just diet and not just exercise.

So I stopped what I was doing on the ocmputer and headed for the health club this evening. Since I keep track and announce it in a FB group every time I do a few more miles, that gives me the incentive I need to skip the excuses and just go do it.

I also have a FB group called "Our Healthy Living." You are welcome to join. It is just a place to share your health goals and successes, or struggles. There is something magical about knowing others are paying attention.

Warmly,

Dr. Erica

item.title: Getting a Spring Look
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
For those of you who do not know, I am a Mary Kay consultant. I absolutely LOVE what Mary Kay has done for my skin, but I also get that many of you looking at cosmetics it is for the color. I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but you need to be more concerned about caring for your largest organ. However, because of your desire to know more about color, I have decided to run a weekly series where I will find a picture that shows a look and then I will show you how it looks on me!

Oh, the best part ... for the ENTIRE WEEK you can get the full look for a discounted price! So, the look I cover at the beginning of the week will remain ON SALE until the following Saturday at 11:59pm CST.

Shall we get started? I chose a very spring look this week. I also went with a look that really accentuates brown eyes. *This look is on sale until Saturday, March 28.*


I only selected a look for my eyes and then complimented it with Pink Passion lipstick and Shy Blush mineral powder blush.

Okay ... let's start with the eyes!

1. Apply the Espresso on the outside corner of your eye, on the lid only.

2. Apply the Hazelnut on the mid part of the lid and then up to the brow line. Blend with the Espresso.

3. Put Glistening Gold on the inside corner of your eye and then blend into your darker browns.

4. Using the smudge brush, smudge the Sweet Plum into your lower eyelashes.

5. Apply black gel eyeliner (one of my all time FAVORITE products) just above the eyelashes on the top only.

6. Finally, finish your eyes off with a couple coats of the Ultimate Mascara in black.

Now to finish off your look!

7. Apply Shy Blush on your cheeks.

8. Line your lips with the Neutral Lip Liner and then Pink Passion for the complete look.

This complete look costs $107 (plus $12 for taxes & shipping) when purchased separately. HOWEVER, until 11:59pm CST on March 28, 2015, you can get this look for $75 (plus $10 for taxes & shipping). That is a savings of over 35%

Again, this is the look for the week. Is there a look you have seen online, on my Facebook page, or on my Pinterest that you would love to see me do? Let me know in the comments below!

item.title: School enrollment time already?
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Believe it or not, it is already time to contemplate enrollment for school next year! Kindergarten round-ups are occurring, and my children are already being asked what electives they are interested in for next year. My little Monkey just finished the process for enrollment in Headstart for the second year, with the hopes that she will still be in the afternoon class and have the same teacher. This will really benefit her.

However, you may be thinking to yourself, I am not sure that public school is the right answer for me. Guess what, I've been there. We weren't sure that public school was the right answer for Peanut and Bullfrog, and we actually educated them at home for a full year. There are times that I think about teaching my younger two at home, but we have some higher needs and I am struggling with my own sanity that we have decided the answer for us right now is public school.

Here are a few things to think about with homeschooling (Sources: The US Department of Education and National Home Education Research Institute):

  1. In 2013, just under 2 million children, or 3.4% of school-aged children, were taught at home

  2. Between 2007 and 2013, the number of families that decided to educate their children at home increased by 17 percent.

  3. It has been shown that children who are educated at home will rank above average in social, emotional, and psychological development! They also are better at leadership skills, family cohesion, self-concept, peer interaction, self-esteem, and helping out in the community.

  4. Students who have been taught at home test better than those in public schools. In fact, they typically score between 15 and 30 percentile points higher on standardized academic achievement test, including the children who have not been taught by parents who are certified teachers!
So ... are you now really interested in educating your child at home but really have no idea where to begin? Have I got great news for you!! Again this year, Midwest Parent Educators (MPE) is having a special deal for the parents of preschoolers at their Homeschool Conference and Curriculum Fair.


The Homeschool Conference and Curriculum Fair will be held April 24 and 25 at the KCI Expo Center. There will be exclusive tracks available for people who are just beginning to homeschool, as well as families who will be teaching children with learning challenges. You will find over 180 exhibitor booths offering information and insight into educating children at home.

Registration for the conference is $50 per person (your spouse is free) at the door ... BUT it is $40 if you register by April 10. HOWEVER ... if you are a parent of a preschool child and have no other school-aged children, your admission is FREE.

Register online for POPS before the April 10th deadline in order to save $10.

Not sure what to do with your children? Yup, the conference has you covered with a Children's Program for kids aged 5-12. Online registration is $35/child for two days for the first two children, BUT any additional siblings will be FREE. If you are looking at only attending one day, the cost is $20/child for the first two children and all other siblings will be FREE. Again, the deadline for online registration is April 10.

The prices WILL BE HIGHER at the door ... if you are even THINKING about homeschooling, this conference is excellent and you will want to register now! If you want more information, visit their website at http://midwesthomeschoolers.org/conference/, call them at 913-599-0311 or email them at info@midwesthomeschoolers.org. They can also be found on Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Fallen in love with Dial's Miracle Oil
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Just a few notes up front. The first ... I usually do not get attached to body wash. I have very few requirements for my body wash and that is that I am left feeling moisturized and secondly, it must smell good. The second note is that I was given a full size bottle of Dial Miracle Oil as a Purex Insider.

This post was supposed to have gone up a few days ago, but it has been a crazy busy spring break in this house. I was not expecting to not really have a chance to get on my blog or website. Therefore, it is going to be kind of a rushed week as I try to squeeze everything I want in before the Blogging A to Z Challenge starts April 1st!

Okay, so ... back to the body wash.



This body wash is so luxurious. It creates a foam with very little work and reminds me of the tropics in the scent. It is a restoring body wash and actually leaves my skin feeling hydrated. This is a hard to master because my skin is SO dry, especially during the winter. Yeah, I know that it is technically spring, but my skin hasn't gotten that memo yet.

So, what's in this moisturizing soap that leaves you with such soft healthy skin?

It has Marula Oil and is formulated with Micro Oil Technology. Marula Oil is an oil that helps to hydrate and protect whatever it is put on. It has been used for years to help rejuvenate the skin and act as an anti-aging tool. It helps protect the skin and erase fine lines. While this may not be something you are worried about on your body, the antioxidants and omega acids leave my skin feeling smooth and hydrated. This is very important for me.

I have every intention of buying more when I run out because I don't need as much soap to clean my entire body. It is also less than $5 at my Target. You can learn more about Dial on their Facebook page or website.

Do you have a favorite soap? Tell me about it in the comments below!

item.title: What's to come this month!
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I thought that it would be a good idea to talk about what's to come this month on the blog. Mainly because this month is going to FLY by and next month is the annual Blogging A to Z Challenge. I will unveil my plan for the challenge near the end of the month. Until then, you get to guess.


Even though Severe Weather Awareness Week is going on RIGHT NOW, I am going to talk about it during the week of the 23rd. I will be covering things to do during severe weather, how to plan properly for them, and prevent the milk & bread shopping crazies. If there is something specific you would like covered, please comment and let me know!



I started the Whole30 challenge on March 1st. It is not a diet necessarily. I honestly do not know what will happen at the end. Right now I am still craving sweets, but not nearly as bad as day 1. I will be doing a video update at the end of each week. If you are asking what in tarnation the Whole30 is and why am I doing it ... you will want to read my blog next week! I will be giving you the 411 and what led up to my decision.


For the first time since 2000 (maybe 1999), I am participating in a 5K. I have already registered so there is no turning back now. Next week, I will tell you all about the Color Run and my push to get going on the C25K program. This is the first of many 5K's I hope to participate in ... but I want to finish one first.


The Big XII Tournament is next week here in Kansas City. All of the hotels are already booked and I will be soaking up the Uber needs! I am going to cover the very basics on my blog since I am not a sports blogger. However, I am a Wildcat through and through, so next week will be loads of fun ... especially since this year has been very tumultuous.


A week after the Big XII Tourney, March Madness begins. I fail every year with my brackets ... come fail with me!


Of course, we cannot forget St. Patrick's Day in the midst of all this. I will talk about some recipes that you can make, a little about the holiday, and some of the festivities that can be found around Kansas City.

I have had some requests for a few other things local to Kansas City, such as Taco Tuesday. If there is anything you ever want me to cover or talk on, let me know! Here are the topics I try to stick to:
  • Kansas City

  • Parenting kids with higher needs

  • Mental, Physical, Spiritual Health

  • Cause Awareness (specifically for Domestic Violence, Cancer, Poverty, Mental Health)

  • Keeping kids safe

  • Technology

  • Natural Living

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Sounds like you have a lot going on. I'm in Vegas, and it was in the 70s today! No severe weather here.

Hi Heather,

It sounds like you have a fun and busy time coming your way!!! A 5K, you're courageous. I love exercise and working out, but I don't like long distance running.

Have a great week~

~ Don Purdum
Thanks. Now we know what's to come this month! :)

item.title: Sharing our love for Disney with others
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Over the weekend we finally got to have our #DisneySide party after almost a month of planning. I was accepted to the DisneySide by Home Celebrations again this year and decided I was going to make it a straight party. Last year, it served as Peanut's birthday party.

When I got the email that I was selected, I learned that I would be getting a generic party box. I was SO happy! I knew that meant a LOT of Mickey and I would be able to tailor it to all ages. I wasn't disappointed either. In the box I was given ALL laundry pods, Mickey plates, cups, and napkins, and decorations. However, they also supplied us with a lot of games and activities, as well as party favors for the guests.

Honestly, I had originally planned to have my party as an adult party, but my kids were growing in disappointment at that decision, so I decided to change. We ended up having a decent size group at the party and everyone had a great time. There are a few things that I will remember for next time:
  • Mail invitations out 2 weeks early cause USPS sucks

  • Purchase Mickey Mouse sprinkles online because they aren't sold in stores

  • Don't believe things that claim they are easy, actually are ... they aren't!

  • Buy pre-sorted M&Ms
I started the prep work the night before, but I really should have given myself even MORE time than that.

The prize table 
The photo wall
Pin the Smile on Mickey game is set up
In addition to getting the major decorations set up, I baked the cake. Our party package came with a Tie-Dye Cake from Duff Goldman. I was SO thankful that the instructions on the box were set up as a tutorial. I felt like Duff was walking me through the process!

The different tie-dye colors: yellow, orange, red, green, and blue. I didn't have enough batter to do purple
Layered and leveled
The tie-dye appearance (we thought it turned out awesome)
I had started on the favor boxes, but after making one ... I sent the task to my minions (battle of the distributors)

I did cut them all out for them ..
They weren't amused
For our treats, we did Mickey Mouse Popcorn, Mickey Mouse M&Ms, Butter Cupcakes, Mickey & Minnie Pretzels, Mickey Mouse Rice Krispie Treats, and Mickey Pizza
Mickey & Minnie Pretzels (candy melts black & red then almond bark dots)
The goodie table (The diamond favor boxes hold the M&Ms)
Our pepperoni pizza with olives shaped like Mickey heads & pepperoni was cut using our cookie cutter from last year)
Again - buy pre-sorted M&Ms. We used the Yellow, Red, and Blue for the party. Hubby bought 4 BIG bags of M&Ms.
Mickey Mouse Popcorn minus the sprinkles (cause you need to buy them online)
Of course, I HAVE to show you a picture of our finished cake. I should have done it the night before so it was a pure rush job. Not my best work ... at all.

Buttercream frosting that I tinted part of it black. The red is actually just the cake!
We didn't just eat though ... we also played games! We played Bingo and Pin the Smile on Mickey (no pictures of Bingo because I forgot to have releases signed)

Pin the smile on Mickey
I really think that the photobooth with the photo props were the favorite by all. I LOVED the photo props and was extremely pleased with the quality of service.

My oldest having a little bit of fun
However, the youngest of the crew had the most fun!
Overall, it was a GREAT time. The kids all left with a package of photo paper, a Mickey tattoo, a Mickey Mouse pencil, and a thank you pack created by Disney. I enjoyed visiting my #DisneySide and look forward to our next celebration!

item.title: I'm all about that "snake oil"
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
I know many of my friends feel essential oils are nothing but fake liquids that people "think" make a difference. I am NOT one of those people. I have seen so many benefits from essential oils, but I do not currently have a favorite. I have heard really good things about Young Living and DoTerra, but those prices are way out of my price range. I have also heard really good things about Plant Therapy and Instanatural, so I was very excited when Instanatural sent me two containers of oil to try out around my house.

I was sent the lemon and peppermint oil to try since I use lavender regularly. I had to do a lot of Google searches to determine the best way to use these oils because they didn't come with a tutorial. I must say that the aroma of these oils is extremely strong and they are very good at letting you know you NEED to dilute before using.

Lemon Essential Oil

Lemon is a natural cleanser and it helps remove grease or oil. I add lemon in my water when I am detoxing, but I do not agree with consuming essential oils. I know that many companies say their oils are pure enough to do it, but it is so unnerving for me to be okay with it. However, here are some ways I have found the lemon essential oil useful in our house.
  • Disinfectant - We have a potty training toddler. Laundry can be a bit stinky. I add a touch of the lemon essential oil to the wash and it removes all of the urine smell. Luckily, she doesn't have too many night accidents. You can also use lemon essential oil and tea tree oil to create a mold remover for your bathroom, although I have heard some swear by using vinegar in the water.

  • Skin Cleanser - Lemon essential oil is great for cleaning your skin. It will take off all of the oil and goo, but you will also find this product in many beauty products. Lemon will cleanse your skin and kill any bacteria that becomes clogged in your pores.

  • Mood Regulator - Use lemon oil in a diffuser or place on your lymph nodes to naturally lift your spirits. It will also help you boost your immune system, which will help you stay happier as well.


Peppermint Oil

When I first used peppermint oil, I thought I had Thin Mints in my house. It was AWFUL. My stomach growled and made me grumpy. So ... be warned. Now, I loved this oil when I was suffering from a mild cold because I could sleep through the night without the cotton mouth the next morning. It has many more benefits though!
  • Nausea - Peppermint is one of my two favorite things to help ease nausea (the other is ginger). When this oil is diluted, you can simply rub the oil on your stomach to help soothe your stomach. However, did you know that the peppermint aroma will help control your appetite (yeah, I am not sure how much it helped since my mind only thought cookies were around).

  • Stress Reducer - Peppermint, like lemon, will help lift your spirit and boost your energy. Peppermint, lavender, and chamomile make for a great combination to de-stress at the end of the day and prepare for a well-rested sleep. You can also apply diluted oil on your neck to help clear your mind.

item.title: Celebrating the Birthday Early
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
One of the biggest things we make sure happens in our house is giving the birthday child a celebratory dinner. We used to just do a birthday dinner at home, but since we have a child with food intolerances ... things get a little tricky. We decided to take Peanut out for her birthday meal to one place she loves to go but we rarely are able to.


BD's Mongolian BBQ has two locations in the KC Metro, but we have only been to the one in Overland Park. It is across the street from Oak Park Mall, for those who are local and want to go after reading this post! Because they are not cheap, we sign up for the Club Mongo, where we get to have 7 family members in the club. We are notified about specials they have going on and then we get a birthday coupon for a BoGo meal!


I decided that since the potential weather postponed her party until March, I would take her out to eat. We got all glammed up and I helped walk her through the paces. If you have never been to BD's, it is very simple. You are given 1 bowl that you will take to the bar and select a noodle base, then meat, then veggies ... finally you select a sauce and any spices you want.


Then you are guided to a place to stand and they cook your food for you!



Then, when your food is done, they will slide it into a different bowl that you take back to your table and devour. The waitress (or waiters) will bring tortillas (or lettuce wraps) and rice. How you eat your meal is completely up to you. You can see in the above picture that they even offer chop sticks.



We ended up getting two bowls, although Peanut took 1/2 of her second bowl home. I NEVER count calories when I go to BD's because I KNOW that it is way too much. It's kinda like Chipotle for me ... totally a cheat day that I never regret because it is enjoyable and rarely happens.


It was a great meal and a great day out. We are still looking forward to her actual party ... but that will be for another post! <3

item.title: Unboxing: Trades of Hope
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
This week has been EXTREMELY emotional for me. There is so much going on in my house that I can't dive into yet and it is just putting me in complete turmoil. However, this blog post has been in the works for a few days ... well, almost a week. I'm sorry, I know!

So, my friend Candy from Mommypalooza, held a Trades of Hope party for her friend. After doing a little research on the company, I knew that it was something that I needed to get behind. Trades of Hope is a company that gives women that ability.


Money is often said to be the root of all evil, but poverty is also the root of many problems. Women will sell themselves, as well as give up children just to stay alive. Oftentimes, women do not lack the ability to provide for their family, but rather lack the opportunity to do so. They feel trapped in their life and feel that their only choice is to sacrifice their bodies and children.

Trades of Hope was created in 2010 to help women break free from this thought process. Women who become artisans are coming out of the sex trade, are disabled or HIV positive, were working in sweatshops, and/or working to care for their children. Trades of Hope is a Fair Trade company that works to help these women create a sustainable income without compromising their dignity.


Trades of Hope was founded by 4 incredible women, mother/daughter duos, who believe that all women should be empowered and have a chance to create a better life for themselves and their families regardless of their circumstances. By creating jobs and sustainable, income-generating businesses, our artisans are able to break the cycle of poverty, feed and take care of their families, and send their children to school. This is not a charitythis is an opportunity to help someone earn a living and also earn dignity and respect in their community!

The artisans are paid FIRST, at their FULL ASKING price. They are guaranteed a LIVING WAGE through Fair Trade principles and they make an average of 4-6 times more selling their products through us than they would in their own country.

The beauty of this jewelry is beyond the actual piece!


Women struggle to raise healthy families in poor, gang-infested, and drug-riddled areas of Costa Rica. Many women are so poor that they have no other way to live but by becoming prostitutes, where they can make $100 an hour. Trades of Hope is excited about this opportunity to offer these women an alternative, a way out of the lifestyle they have been forced to live. As these Costa Rican women create beautiful products, they are learning how to provide for their families in a way that they can be proud of! Because of the artisans sales, this ministry is also able to do more for the community through outreach and support. Sustainable business teaches these women how valuable and important they truly are, and these women are able to pass this sense of dignity down to their children, shaping Costa Ricas next generation!

I decided to make my purchase because of the story behind the piece. I could have purchased Turtle a turtle backpack anywhere ... but I KNEW that I was helping a woman put food on her table in Guatemala. Each backpack is handmade and no two are alike. It was one way that I felt like I could do something *read on to see how you can help as well*


I was not the only one who was excited about the purchase. I did an unboxing video to show the excitement on a young girl's face. Unfortunately, I failed to inform my eldest that you MUST turn the camera sideways when taking video, but life will go on!

So, how can you help Trades of Hope? It's super simple!


Keep those cereal boxes!


The beads on these pieces of jewelry are hand-crafted, made from cereal boxes and clay. The color is rich, warm, and just beautiful. Save those cereal boxes --ONE provides $40 worth of material! Just another facet of sustainability for our artisans' businesses!! I can help find an compassionate entrepreneur in your area, or I am willing to pay for you to break them down and ship them to me!

I am looking forward to meeting with one of the co-founders of this company next week and learning more about them. This company speaks my love language ... empowerment and equal opportunities!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: This is such a beautiful post! Thanks for sharing! Your daughter seemed so happy to have her turtle hand made backpack!^_^ I think it is great what Trades Of Hope is doing for women. I would absolutely love to hear more about this and how I could help!

Thank you so much for such a thoughtful and beautifully written post! I am so honored and humbled to be involved with this company. Ladies of you reading this--there are so many of our sisters around the world--mothers like us, who want to provide for their families and improve their circumstances. THEY need US to be their voices. Our wise, visionary founders know that Direct Sales HERE leads to jobs for women around the world. We are their market! This is a partnership! Please reach out to me via alitradesofhope@gmail.com to learn more about how you can be a VOICE--by Joining our team of amazing Compassionate Entrepreneurs, Hosting a Party with a Purpose, or choosing to shop with intent and with desire to improve the lives on the other end of that pretty item! I look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Tackling BIG Topics
item.dc:creator: kcbusymom@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Well, tonight was the 87th Annual Academy Awards ... otherwise known as the Oscars. Neil Patrick Harris did an EXCELLENT job as a host (totally not surprised). However, he broke through the stigma of being what you wear being important. How? By showing off his killer body in his tighty whities. Doogie - you are so cute.

I actually live tweeted the entire event and was really surprised with a few of the presentations and some of the winners. Let me give you my highlights and then give you the list of winners.

The first was DEFINITELY Patricia Arquette's acceptance speech. I was rooting for Meryl Streep to win Best Supporting Actress because I LOVED her role in Into the Woods. However, Patricia, well, I'll let the memes speak for me.



Or my favorite ... Meryl Streep's response!
Yes, says Meryl Streep. Yes. pic.twitter.com/sogBD0Dkkf
Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) February 23, 2015
~ Emily (@ColoradoMom) February 23, 2015I totally agree, Meryl. That deserves a HUGE fist pump. And I will have this meme playing anytime I get something accomplished in my house.

Okay, moving on ... To recover from such a moving speech, Neil Patrick Harris broke the Oscars. Don't believe me?


Yup, that is Doogie Howser in nothing but tighty whities and black socks. I actually got this picture during the news recap because my brain couldn't function during the actual Oscars. I was too busy picking my jaw up off the ground.

However, the shock did wear off. While I was waiting for the next thing to blow me away, I was surprised to realize The Lego Movie was not nominated. The stupid song Everything is Awesome was. You know, really, that song wouldn't be so bad, but it gets stuck in my head EVERY time someone sings it ... and it gets sung anytime someone says something is awesome.

In addition to that shock, during the In Memoriam that Meryl Streep introduced, there were two very influential people who were ignored! Joan Rivers and Elaine Stritch both passed away in 2014 and neither were shown. I also am not sure why they only did sketches instead of showing live clips.

Before I forget ... John Travolta is a TOTAL creeper!

John Legend brought the feels back with Glory. Not one dry eye in the audience, and there were tears in my eyes at home. Then when they won Best Original Song they brought politics into the Oscars.


Right now, the struggle for freedom and justice is real. - John Legend

Following that moving speech, Lady Gaga came out to do a musical piece. I was prepared to be extremely irritated because it was the Sound of Music. You cannot mess with my childhood movie. There is no way I would EVER put Lady Gaga and Julie Andrews in the same room, but it is a good thing that I am not in charge. Lady Gaga totally blew me away. I forget that she can really sing. The feels happened when she was done giving me goosebumps. Julie Andrews gave her the biggest hug and major props.


Ignore the haters, Lady Gaga ... You rocked it!


Some other issues that were touched on were ALS, Alzheimer's and Suicide Awareness. Graham Moore won for Imitation Game and we are so glad that he didn't get cut off when he said he had one more thing. He admitted that he battled depression and attempted suicide when he was 16. He was so glad that he was still here, but he never felt like he fit in. He left us with the best piece of advice ... Stay Weird. Stay Different.



The Oscars brought tears of joy and tackled serious issues. My friend, Kelly, stated it best on her Twitter profile:
